diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with right lower quadrant (RLQ) abdominal pain that migrated, associated with nausea and vomiting. Physical examination revealed exquisite tenderness to palpation in RLQ over McBurney's point, with positive Rovsing and psoas signs. CT abdomen and pelvis indicated a dilated fluid-filled appendix with appendicolith and surrounding fat stranding, confirming the diagnosis of acute appendicitis.
